    • Field Detail

      • logger

        private static final org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger logger

      • project

        private static Project project
        TODO: If a commodity is consumed, it must be produced. Every social class must have a sales stock for labour power even if it doesn't have any to sell (!) If a commodity type is productive, we should disallow stocks of it being consumption goods, and vice versa Every class should have a sales stock of labour power even if it doesn't produce it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Validate

        public Validate()

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public static boolean validate()
        carry out the global validation tests on the timeStamp and project records. Carry out the project-specific tests
        Returns:
        true if all tests are passed, false otherwise

      • validate

        public static boolean validate(int projectID)
        Conduct the per-project validation tests for the project with ID projectID
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project to be validated
        Returns:
        true if all tests are passed, false otherwise

      • timeStampIntegrity

        public static boolean timeStampIntegrity()
        TimeStamp integrity test No timeStamp should exist in the database that refers to a project which does not exist. Every timeStamp that is referenced by a project record should exist This is a global integrity test, and is not project-specific
        Returns:
        true if the database passes this test, false otherwise

      • projectIntegrity

        public static boolean projectIntegrity()
        there should be a Project record for every project that is referenced by any other table in the database
        Returns:
        true if the project passes the test, false otherwise

      • timeStampIntegrity

        public static boolean timeStampIntegrity(int projectID)
        Per project timeStamp integrity test There should be a TimeStamp record for every timeStamp that is referenced by any other table in the database
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project whose integrity is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if the project passes the test, false otherwise

      • consumerGoodTest

        public static boolean consumerGoodTest(int projectID)
        test existence of consumer goods
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project we are testing
        Returns:
        true if the project passes this test, false otherwise

      • labourPowerTest

        private static boolean labourPowerTest(int projectID)
        A commodity called Labour Power must exist at all times
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project being tested
        Returns:
        true if a commodity called Labour Power exists, false otherwise

      • stockCommodityExistsTest

        private static boolean stockCommodityExistsTest(int projectID)
        Every stock's commodity must exist
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project to which the test should be applied
        Returns:
        true if the project passes this test, false otherwise

      • stockOwnerExists

        private static boolean stockOwnerExists(int projectID)
        Every stock must belong to either an industry or a social class that exists.
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project being tested
        Returns:
        true if a commodity called Labour Power exists, false otherwise

      • validStockType

        private static boolean validStockType(int projectID)
        every stock must have a stock type in the enum STOCKTYPE
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project being tested
        Returns:
        true if a commodity called Labour Power exists, false otherwise

      • industryProduct

        private static boolean industryProduct(int projectID)
        Every industry's product must be an existing commodity. The industry must have a sales stock and a money stock of this commodity. - we don't check that all the productive stocks of this industry are existing commodities, because that is taken care of by stockCommodityExists
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project to which the test should be applied
        Returns:
        true if the project passes this test, false otherwise

      • inputCompleteness

        public static boolean inputCompleteness(int projectID)
        Every Industry must have exactly one stock of every possible productive input
        Parameters:
        projectID - the ID of the project to check
        Returns:
        true if the test completes successfully, false if any errors are discovered
